Column Comment.0: ACTIVITY SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a set of activities
Column Comment.1: ACTIVITY TYPE IDENTIFIER: the unique identifier or code for the activity.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVITY SET IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a valid set of activity codes, suchas those required by a regulatory or professional agency.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that is tracked, such as drilling, testing, coring,tubing etc. May be any kind of activity related to well operations.
Column Comment.4: ACTITIVTY EQUIVALENCE OBS NO: Unique number assigned to the equivalence.The type of equivalance is subject to the definitions of the creator of an activity set(such as by regulation), so it is possible for these equivalences to change over time.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EQUIVALENCE OWNER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier forthe business associate who owns this equivalence.
Column Comment.8: WELL ACTIVITY TYPE EQUIVALENCE: This value can be used to qualify theequivalence measure, so that you can set up equivalences for activities that areclosely related, or for activities that subsume or are fully equivalent with anotheractivity type.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.10: WELL ALIAS: Full alias name or code assigned to a well by a partner, agency orapplicaiton.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
